timeline.message:
[eclipse/xtext#1679]ported more code to java

Signed-off-by: Christian Dietrich <christian.dietrich@itemis.de>

timeline.bodyText: Not sure if it's really better: expression.getElements().stream().allMatch(this::isValidAnnotationValue)
timeline.author: szarnekow

timeline.bodyText: I'd like to avoid IterableExtensions and friends in production code
timeline.author: szarnekow
szarnekow

timeline.bodyText: T extends Object -> T is sufficient
timeline.author: szarnekow
szarnekow
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,59 @@
+/**
+ * Copyright (c) 2012 itemis AG (http://www.itemis.eu) and others.
+ * This program and the accompanying materials are made available under the
+ * terms of the Eclipse Public License 2.0 which is available at
+ * http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-2.0.
+ * 
+ * SPDX-License-Identifier: EPL-2.0
+ */
+package org.eclipse.xtext.xbase.compiler;
+
+import org.eclipse.xtext.xbase.compiler.output.ITreeAppendable;
+import org.eclipse.xtext.xbase.lib.IterableExtensions;
+import org.eclipse.xtext.xbase.lib.Procedures.Procedure1;
+
+import com.google.common.collect.Iterables;
+
+/**
+ * @author Jan Koehnlein
+ */
+public class LoopExtensions {
+	/**
+	 * Iterates elements and execute the procedure. A prefix, a separator and a
+	 * suffix can be initialized with the loopInitializer lambda.
+	 */
+	public <T extends Object> void forEach(ITreeAppendable appendable, Iterable<T> elements,

timeline.bodyText: A few unnecessary param types in the lambdas
timeline.author: szarnekow

timeline.bodyText: Looks like we could extract a single protected method here
timeline.author: szarnekow
szarnekow
